peregrine.http
Class HttpClient

java.lang.Object
  peregrine.http.HttpClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpClientWriter, HttpDeleteMethod, HttpGetMethod, HttpHeadMethod
public class HttpClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

General functionality across all HTTP methods. This client only supports HTTP chunked encoding for all methods because this is what Peregrine requires and the code would be more complicated and would make for a less elegant API.

waitForResponse

public void waitForResponse()
                     throws HttpClientException
Wait for an HTTP response from this channel. Without necessarily closing it. This can be used for connection reuse (AKA HTTP keep-alive). This is (by definition) a synchronous operation.

Throws:
HttpClientException

           throws HttpClientException

getContent

public org.jboss.netty.buffer.ChannelBuffer getContent()
                                                throws HttpClientException
Get content written to this channel. While it does not seem that some methods like HEAD and DELETE would have content they MAY if the response code is an error code.

Returns:
The content from the HTTP response or null if no content is available yet.
Throws:
HttpClientException
